title: How to Make an Origami Snail

steps.headline: Start off with a piece of square paper.
steps.description: You can tell if the paper is square by folding it in half diagonally. If you have any excess on one side, trim it off.

steps.headline: If you're using patterned paper, place the patterned side down, and fold it in half to make a triangle.
steps.description: This ensures that your pattern will end up on the outside. Open up the folded piece.

steps.headline: Fold one end to meet the line in the center.
Fold the other end to meet the line in the centre.
Then, fold the left side to meet the centre, and do the same for the other side.
Make a fold.
steps.description: Fold approximately where the dotted line is shown in this image.

steps.headline: Fold it back on itself, like so.
Make a crease in the front half, as shown in the image.
steps.description: Use this crease to help you push the front up into the centre of the snail. Line up the two sides at the front. Make a matching crease in the other side, so that you can lay it flat.

steps.headline: Cut a little slit at the top.
steps.description: Fold one side down jauntily to make the eye stalks.

steps.headline: Admire your handiwork.
steps.description: Draw a spiral design for the shell. Discerning snail fans will notice the spiral in this photo is drawn the wrong way - artistic licence!

text: Start off with a piece of square paper. You can tell if the paper is square by folding it in half diagonally. If you have any excess on one side, trim it off. If you're using patterned paper, place the patterned side down, and fold it in half to make a triangle. This ensures that your pattern will end up on the outside. Open up the folded piece. Fold one end to meet the line in the center.  Fold the other end to meet the line in the centre.  Then, fold the left side to meet the centre, and do the same for the other side.  Make a fold. Fold approximately where the dotted line is shown in this image. Fold it back on itself, like so. This makes the tail. Fold the paper in half.  Make a crease in the front half, as shown in the image. Use this crease to help you push the front up into the centre of the snail. Line up the two sides at the front. Make a matching crease in the other side, so that you can lay it flat. Cut a little slit at the top. Fold one side down jauntily to make the eye stalks. Admire your handiwork. Draw a spiral design for the shell. Discerning snail fans will notice the spiral in this photo is drawn the wrong way - artistic licence! Finished.
